p: The obtained results disclosed that all the screened pyridazines possessed excellent to moderate anticancer action against the two tested breast cancer (T-47D and MDA-MB-231) cell lines, whereas they displayed weak to non-significant cytotoxic impact against the tested ovarian cancer (SKOV-3) cell line, Table 1. Nonetheless, it was noted that the screened pyridazines 11a–r exhibited differential activities against the two tested human breast cancer cell lines; 8 out of 18 compounds were more active against T-47D than MDA-MB-231, whereas 10 out of 18 compounds were more active against MDA-MB-231 than T-47D as indicated in Table 1. In details, T-47D cells were more sensitive (IC 50 range 0.44 ± 0.01 − 11.44 ± 0.37 µM) to the influence of all 2-adamantyl-bearing pyridazines 11a–e (except 11d), tert-butyl-bearing pyridazines 11f–h (except 11 g) and butyl-bearing pyridazine ( 11i) than MDA-MB-231 cells (IC 50 range 2.18 ± 0.07 − 34.59 ± 1.13 µM), Table 1. On the contrary, the methyltetrahydropyran-bearing pyridazines 11j–l and 2-(trifluoromethyl)benzyl-bearing pyridazines 11n–r displayed better cytotoxic activity against MDA-MB-231 (IC 50 range 1.30 ± 0.04 − 19.71 ± 0.64 µM) than T-47D cell line (IC 50 range 1.57 ± 0.05 − 35.9 ± 1.18 µM).
